text: Una cosa es ser solidario, otra cosa ser IRRESPONSABLE con el pais. No es xenofobia pedir visa, antecendentes penales, por lo menos pasaporte... lo que muchos no saben y lo ha dicho el MINISTRO DEL INTERIOR, dejan pasar a miles de venezolanos SOLO CON SU CEDULA (DNI VENEZOLANO)... que no cumple con los minimos condiciones de seguridad si los datos ahi son reales o no, es decir, un venezolano delincuente puede ingresar con esa cedula falsificada y no hay forma de detectarlo. Ademas esta el tema que el Per√∫ tiene mucho desempleo y subempleo, y por logica a entrar tantos venezolanos sin trabajo aumenta el desempleo, el comercio ambulatorio, la informalidad, el crimen. ES COMO DICEN: NO PUEDES DEJAR DE ATENDER A TUS HIJOS, PARA ATENDER A LOS HIJOS AJENOS.
english_text: It is one thing to be supportive, another thing to be IRRESPONSIBLE with the country. It is not xenophobia to ask for a visa, a criminal record, at least a passport... what many do not know and the MINISTRY OF THE INTERIOR has said, they let thousands of Venezuelans through ONLY WITH THEIR CEDULA (VENEZUELAN DNI)... which does not comply with the minimum security conditions if the data there are real or not, that is, a criminal Venezuelan can enter with that falsified ID and there is no way to detect it. There is also the issue that Peru has a lot of unemployment and underemployment, and logically to enter so many Venezuelans without work increases unemployment, ambulatory commerce, informality, crime. IT IS AS THEY SAY: YOU CANNOT STOP CARING FOR YOUR CHILDREN, TO CARE FOR THE CHILDREN OF OTHERS.
paraphrased_text1: Paraphrased: It's not xenophobic to ask for a valid visa, identity documents, or a passport- something which the Ministry of Interior has acknowledged when allowing thousands of Venezuelans to enter with only a cedula. This could be extremely dangerous because it enables criminals with falsified documents to pass, thus leading to increasing unemployment, informal trade, and ultimately, crime. In the end, caring for your own family must be done before looking after the outside.
paraphrased_text2: Paraphrased Text: It's one thing to be supportive and another to be reckless with the country. Requiring a visa, a background check, and a passport is not xenophobia. The Ministry of the Interior has reported that thousands of Venezuelans are allowed in with only their ID card, which poses a security risk as this doesn't ensure that any identities are genuine. Furthermore, having an influx of unemployed Venezuelans coming in without jobs adds to unemployment, informality, and crime. As they say, you can't take care of others' children when you don't take care of your own.
paraphrased_text3: Hate Content: It is completely unacceptable for the Ministry of Interior to allow thousands of Venezuela's entry into Peru with just their falsified ID! This is a complete disregard for the country's security measures and will only lead to an increase in unemployment, crime, and ambulatory commerce. It is time to stop concerning ourselves with the welfare of outsiders and start caring for our own people first!
paraphrased_text4: Paraphrase: It is understandable to want to exercise caution with who is allowed into the country, and although some may consider it xenophobia, asking visa applicants to prove their identity and criminal record is reasonable. Unfortunately, despite Ministry of the Interior officials asserting that only Venezuelans with their Cedula are allowed to enter, the authenticity of the ID cannot be easily confirmed. This influx of Venezuelans is additionally problematic because the labour force in Peru is already inundated and additional workers without jobs exacerbates the probability of crime, informal transactions, and more unemployment. The saying goes: you cannot take care of someone else's kids while simultaneously
paraphrased_text5: Paraphrase: It is understandable to want to support people in need, however it is also essential to consider the security of a nation. Requesting a visa, criminal record, or passport is not an act of xenophobia but rather a requirement adhered to by the Ministry of the Interior. Sadly, Venezuelans enter Peru unhindered simply with their cedula, meaning criminals are able to pass border control without so much as being detected. To make matters worse, the influx of immigrants leads to an increase in unemployment, informal markets, and illegal activity. IT IS PROPER TO TAKE CARE OF ONE'S OWN

Esto podr√≠a ser extremadamente peligroso porque permite el paso de delincuentes con documentos falsificados, lo que lleva a un aumento del desempleo, el comercio informal y, en √∫ltima instancia, la delincuencia. Al final, cuidar de la propia familia debe hacerse antes que cuidar del exterior.

text: Por supuesto que los inmigrantes tienen la culpa del paro. La inmigraci√≥n masiva que hemos venido sufriendo ha sido una reforma laboral encubierta que ha generado bajadas generalizadas de sueldos -precisamente la hosteler√≠a es el ejemplo m√°s claro-, ha torpedeado cualquier negociaci√≥n colectiva obligando a negociar siempre a la baja y ha convertido la oferta laboral no-cualificada en algo tan poco apetecible para los espa√±oles que han preferido la econom√≠a sumergida o el paro antes que aceptar ofertas de empleo en esas condiciones. La inmigraci√≥n ha sido un dumping laboral y social sin precedentes en Espa√±a. No solo es culpable directa de las tasas de paro entre los espa√±oles, sino tambi√©n, por ejemplo, de la bajada sostenida de la productividad y de la p√©rdida generalizada de poder adquisitivo de los trabajadores.
english_text: Of course immigrants are to blame for unemployment. The massive immigration that we have been suffering has been a covert labor reform that has generated generalized decreases in salaries - precisely the hospitality industry is the clearest example -, it has torpedoed any collective bargaining, forcing to always negotiate downwards and has turned the job offer -qualified in something so unappetizing for Spaniards who have preferred the underground economy or unemployment rather than accept job offers under those conditions. Immigration has been an unprecedented labor and social dumping in Spain. It is not only directly to blame for unemployment rates among Spaniards, but also, for example, for the sustained drop in productivity and the general loss of purchasing power of workers.

It has caused wages to be driven into the ground, collective bargaining to be disregarded and job offers to be practically impossible for citizens of the country. This influx of migrants has led to an unprecedented labor and social dumping, resulting in low productivity, lower purchasing power for workers and higher levels of unemployment among the native population.

Example 1:

Immigrants are the root cause of unemployment. Thanks to the influx of foreign workers, salaries have been driven down to an all-time low in sectors such as the hospitality industry. This has destroyed collective bargaining for workers, making it impossible to negotiate a decent wage and has resulted in a dramatic rise in underground economy, with more Spaniards opting for the financial instability or unemployment instead. Immigration policies have been nothing more than a way of socially and economically exploiting Spanish citizens, which is directly responsible for rising unemployment rates, lower productivity, and an overall decrease in the purchasing power of workers.

Immigration is thus evidently the main contributor to unemployment amongst Spaniards, as well as other issues such as productivity loss and the overall reduction of worker purchasing power.

This unabating immigration has caused a substantial influx of workers, resulting in a decrease in productivity and the economic degradation of Spanish people, making unemployment the only possible option for many. It is clear that immigration is the root of the unemployment issue in Spain.
paraphrased_text5: Paraphrase: The arrival of immigrants in the country has resulted in a major shakeup in the labor market, leading to salary cuts through the entire country, especially evident in the hospitality sector. This cheapening of labor market conditions has caused Spanish citizens to search for underground economy alternatives or go without a job at all, as it is not agreeable for them. The influx of immigrants has created a situation of labor and social policies that have negatively impacted Spanish citizens, leading to higher unemployment counts and decreased purchasing power and economic productivity overall.

english_text: More arguments could be given, but with the ones you give, they are already served. The government is a government of cowards, they are so cowardly that they don't even dare to change an inherited law, let alone the terror that gives them thinking that the media will call them murderers if they don't pay. On the other hand, the money is not theirs, it is ours and they are specialists in spending our money. It is moral relativism, the life of some Spaniards is worth more than the life of, say, five hundred Syrians or more, who can die because of that money. I don't know about you, but it disgusts me infinitely.
paraphrased_text1: Paraphrase: Despite giving persuasive arguments, the government is reluctant to modify laws, out of fear of potential public backlashes. I am revolted by what I am seeing.
paraphrased_text2: Paraphrased TEXT: The cowardly leadership of the government is afraid to even alter existing statutes, let alone the dread they feel of being labeled as callous by the press if they don't part with their hard-earned cash. This lack of empathy will make many of us feel fierce disdain.
paraphrased_text3: Paraphrase: It seems that the government lacks courage to modify existing laws, because they are scared of what the media might say about them instead. paraphrased_text4: PARAPHRASED TEXT: It is incomprehensible why the current government would refuse to change a law that was passed down to them. This sense of moral relativism disgusts me, where one Spanish life is valued more than five hundred Syrians, or more. My thoughts on this are unjustified and unjustifiable.

text: No me hables de los britanicos, porque son los tipicos que pretenden aplicar a los demas la medicina que ellos nunca ponen consigo mismos. Aun te olvidas de que los britanicos han entonado incluso panegiricos hagiograficos hacia su dictador particular (muchisimo peor que Franco), dedicandole incluso peliculas y de las buenas (Cromwell, 1970, con Richard Harris como protagonista). Yo conozco muy bien un pueblo en Irlanda (pues fui varios veranos alli con estudiantes de ingles) en el cual hay una abadia en ruinas, y a la entrada de la misma una inscripcion contando como las tropas de Cromwell, por orden de este, lo incendiaron y quemaron alli dentro vivas a mas de trescientas personas, los monjes y los habitantes catolicos del pueblo alli refugiados, ancianos, mujeres y ninnos. No es caso unico.
english_text: Don't talk to me about the British, because they are the typical ones who try to apply to others the medicine that they never put on themselves. You still forget that the British have even sung hagiographic panegyrics towards their particular dictator (much worse than Franco), dedicating even good movies to him (Cromwell, 1970, with Richard Harris as the protagonist). I know very well a town in Ireland (because I went there several summers with English students) in which there is an abbey in ruins, and at the entrance to it an inscription telling how Cromwell's troops, by order of this, burned it down. And they burned alive inside there more than three hundred people, the monks and the Catholic inhabitants of the town, refugees there, the elderly, women and children. It is not a unique case.
paraphrased_text1: Paraphrased TEXT : Do not discuss the British with me, as they continually try to preach what they do not follow. Remember that the British even glorified their own tyrannical leader through song and film (Cromwell, 1970, with Richard Harris as the star). I am aware of a ruined abbey in Ireland that bears a sign at its entrance stating that Cromwell's forces, under his orders, set the building ablaze with more than three hundred people inside, including priests, locals, and the elderly, women, and children. This is not a singular incident.
paraphrased_text2: Paraphrased Text: I have no time for British people, as they are hypocrites to others after never taking their own medicine. What they have done, even going as far as to write songs to praise their oppressive ruler is beyond deplorable. For example, I can think of a small town I once visited in Ireland. The remains of abbey at the entrance with an inscription recounting how bogus orders from Cromwell resulted in the burning alive of over three hundred people who sought refuge in the abbey, includes elderly, women, and children. Unfortunately, this was not a singular instance.
paraphrased_text3: Paraphrased TEXT: The people from Britain might seem saintly, but they have honoured some other despots in the past. Cromwell was one such tyrant who in the year 1970 was immortalized in a movie with Richard Harris playing the lead role. An example of the atrocities that Cromwell is remembered for is the burning of an abbey in Ireland, where 300 people, including elderly, women, and children were burned alive under his orders. This is not the only example of such appalling crimes.
paraphrased_text4: Paraphrased TEXT: Don't speak to me of the British; their treatment of others is far different from the way they handle themselves. One great example was that they even dedicated hagiographic songs and films, such as Cromwell (1970 starring Richard Harris), to their own dictator, much worse than Franco. Sera una opcion. para respetar el dinero del contribuyente. de esta forma.evitaremos gastos, del Herario Nacional.y ¬¥por consiguiente alteraciones en la Ley de Presupuesto de la Nacion..Creo que los Srs. I believe that the Parliamentarians, who support immigration, will enter quickly with a Bill, in this way. magnitude.

How to negatively judge someone who is disinterested in their luck?
